subject: Home & DIY
title: Tiny Houses and the Space Revolt
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Tiny Houses and the Space Revolt.

hook.text: The average American home grew from 90 to 230 square meters between 1950 and 2020. Then the tiny house happened.

buildup.text: Tiny houses are typically under 40 square meters. They force owners to question what they actually need.

discovery.text: The movement exploded after the 2008 financial crisis when people wanted freedom from mortgages and excess.

twist.text: Zoning laws in most cities actually ban tiny houses. The legal fight over minimum dwelling size continues today.

climax.text: Tiny living isn't about deprivationâ€”it's a design challenge to make small spaces feel spacious and complete.

punchline.text: Less square footage, more life per meter.
